Drépanocytose homozygote C'est la forme: Homozygous sickle cell disease This is the most serious form. It means that the two genes are mutated. It manifests before the age of two years, between 12 and 18 months and is characterized by
Association de Lutte Contre la Drepanocy: Association de Lutte Contre la Drepanocytose
Dans sa forme homozygote, la drépanocyto: In its homozygous form, sickle cell disease manifests itself in children aged 12-18 months by:
Des crises douloureuses abdominales et d: Painful abdominal attacks and pain in the limbs
Drépanocytose : qu'est-ce que c'est ?: Sickle cell disease: what is it?
La Drépanocytose est une maladie génétiq: Sickle cell disease is a genetic disease caused by an abnormality in the hemoglobin contained in red blood cells causing them to deform and destroy
Leur destruction entraîne une anémie chr: Their destruction leads to severe chronic anemia and their deformity is accompanied by very painful circulatory disorders. It is the most widespread genetic disease in the world but little known. It affects around 50 million people with a predilection for Black Africa. . Nearly half of children with this disease die before being screened in developing countries
association de lutte contre la drépanocy: association for the fight against sickle cell anemia
DORYS est une association de lutte contr: DORYS is an association for the fight against sickle cell disease. It was registered by the Strasbourg District Court in the Register of Associations on 02/23/04, in volume 82 folio n ° 45.It is managed by its statutes.
par renforcement du dépistage dans les p: by strengthening screening in populations at risk and better patient care,
aide à la mise en place sécurité transfu: help in setting up transfusion safety
aide à l’amélioration de la qualité de l: helps improve water quality: hydration is very important in sickle cell patients
